channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At a Shared Symbol of Jihad, the Taliban Defy Their Old Ties With Pakistan
item.description: Afghan officials are lashing out against their former allies in the Pakistani military as hostilities between the two countries intensify.

item.title: Disaster and insurance costs are rising. The middle class is struggling to hang on
item.description: Middle-class families are struggling to afford insurance in southwest Florida. Realtors say a wave of foreclosures could be coming.

item.title: This Is How Our Economy Comes Crashing Down
item.description: Some of the pieces seem fine, but the base is increasingly fragile

item.title: She lost her purse — but strangers stepped in to save the day
item.description: On a trip to Chicago, Lavonne Schaafsma lost her purse. Two women saw a man rifling through it — and stepped in to help.

item.title: Trump’s Surprise Pivot on the Epstein Files, and Why Crypto A.T.M.s Are a Hub for Scams
item.description: Plus, Hollywood’s star-studded movies are tanking.

item.title: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling schools. It wants underfunded districts to take them on
item.description: Rural school district superintendents are trying to find the best use of limited resources. Taking on the state's unmaintained buildings, they say, wi...

item.title: Aiming to Shock Japan, China Pushes a Wave of Reprisals
item.description: Beijing is flexing its military and economic might to show its displeasure with the Japanese leader’s comments about defending Taiwan. But its aggress...

item.title: More women are renting dresses, coats and ugly sweaters as clothing prices tick up
item.description: More women are planning to deck the halls in rented fashion this year, just as inflation and tariffs are poised to push clothing prices higher.

item.title: With 'Baby Botox,' young adults strive to keep wrinkles from ever forming
item.description: A growing number of 20-somethings are trying to freeze time with preventative Botox treatments. Here's what's behind the trend.

item.title: At Catholic Churches, Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Takes Center Stage
item.description: Immigration was on the minds of priests and parishioners following a letter from the nation’s Catholic bishops decrying how immigrants are being treat...

item.title: Too Powerful to Ignore, Saudi Prince Returns to Washington’s Embrace
item.description: Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is to visit the White House on Tuesday for the first time since 2018, when the killing of a journalist by Saudi agent...

item.title: Women Toiling in India’s Insufferable Heat Face Mounting Toll on Health
item.description: Prolonged exposure to hot weather can hinder people’s ability to lead safe and productive lives, experts say.

item.title: How Many People Die in India From Hot Weather? Nobody Really Knows.
item.description: Officials have yet to grasp the magnitude of heat-related deaths, let alone effectively deal with the problem, public health experts and scientists sa...
